intro: Diascia hexensis, commonly known as the six-petaled scarlet glory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers with six petals. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it an attractive addition to gardens. Diascia hexensis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
